result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon B. Robinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brandon B. Robinson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brandon B. Robinson was found guilty of Misdemeanor Retail Theft [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 10 days sentence credit off of the fine amount

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

CK 040600 mailed to A.H.; remainder of cash bond.

(Case called at 4:00 PM)
Defendant Brandon B. Robinson in court with Attorney Sarah McCracken.  Attorney Meri C. Larson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Agreement reached.  Defense outlines agreement for the Court.  State in compliance with victim notification requirements.  No restitution claimed in this case.  Court finds Defendant guilty based on plea of No Contest to Count 1 as amended to Misdemeanor Retail Theft (PTAC).  Court orders $100 fine + costs.  Defendant granted 10 days jail credit.
